column2: User Query
column3: Chatbot Response

column2: Where is the PIA check-in counter?
column3: The Pakistan International Airlines (PIA) check-in counters are located in Row C near Gate 4 of the departure hall.

column2: What time does check-in open for international flights?
column3: International check-in normally opens three hours before departure and closes one hour prior.

column2: Can I check in online for Airblue?
column3: Yes, Airblue allows online check-in via their website or mobile app.

column2: Where can I print my boarding pass?
column3: You can print your boarding pass at self-service kiosks near the main entrance or request a printed copy from your airline’s desk.

column2: Which row handles Serene Air check-in?
column3: Serene Air counters are in Row B, Counters 8-12 on the right side of the hall.

column2: What documents do I need for domestic check-in?
column3: For domestic flights, please carry your original CNIC and flight booking.

column2: How early should I reach the airport for a domestic flight?
column3: Arrive at least two hours before departure to allow time for check-in, baggage tagging, and security scanning.

column2: Is there a family or priority lane at check-in?
column3: Yes, families with children and elderly passengers may use the priority counter located beside Counter 5.

column2: Where do I pay for excess baggage?
column3: Extra luggage payments can be made at your airline’s excess-baggage desk near Row D. Keep the receipt to show at baggage-drop.

column2: Can I use my mobile boarding pass at security?
column3: Absolutely! Mobile boarding passes are accepted at Islamabad Airport. Make sure the QR code is visible on your screen for scanning.

column2: What is the hand-carry weight limit?
column3: Most airlines allow 7 kg of hand-carry per passenger, excluding laptops and small personal items. Oversized bags may be checked.

column2: Is there a self-check-in kiosk available?
column3: Yes, self-check-in kiosks are located near Departure Hall B. You can print your boarding pass and baggage tags in under two minutes.

column2: Where can I find baggage-wrapping service?
column3: A 24-hour baggage-wrapping booth is available beside Gate 3. It provides protective film and labeling for your luggage.

column2: How long does the check-in process usually take?
column3: On average, check-in takes 15 to 25 minutes depending on passenger traffic. Business-class counters are generally faster.

column2: Which side is the Qatar Airways counter?
column3: Qatar Airways check-in is at Row A, Counters 1-6, facing the international section. Staff there assist with Doha and connecting flights.

column2: Can I check in sports equipment?
column3: Yes, sports gear can be checked at the Oversized Baggage counter near Row D. Please ensure it’s packed securely to avoid damage.

column2: What should I do if I forgot to print my ticket?
column3: No worries! Show your e-ticket or CNIC at the airline desk and they will print a boarding pass for you.

column2: Can I check in multiple bags?
column3: Yes, as long as your total checked weight stays within your airline’s limit. Extra kilograms may require a small fee.

column2: Where can I weigh my luggage?
column3: Weighing machines are installed near each airline’s counter and at the baggage-wrapping station.

column2: Is vaccination proof still required for check-in?
column3: Some international destinations still ask for vaccination certificates. Keep a digital or printed copy handy to avoid delays.

column2: Can I upgrade to business class during check-in?
column3: Upgrades depend on seat availability. You can request it at the counter or check online for promotional offers.

column2: What happens if I reach after check-in closes?
column3: If the gate has closed, the airline cannot process your luggage. You may be rebooked on the next available flight subject to policy.

column2: Is there a separate area for international passengers?
column3: Yes, international check-in rows (A and B) are located near immigration entry, clearly marked with blue signs.

column2: Where can I find trolley service?
column3: Trolleys are available near entrances and around all check-in rows. A refundable coin token is required at some stations.

column2: Can I get fragile labels for my baggage?
column3: Yes, inform the counter staff and they will attach a “Fragile” tag to ensure careful handling.

column2: Where can I collect flight information?
column3: Digital screens throughout the departure area display current flight status, gate numbers, and counter assignments.

column2: Are check-in counters open 24 hours?
column3: Only for airlines with night operations, such as Qatar Airways or Emirates. Domestic counters open 3 hours before flights.

column2: Can I drop my luggage after online check-in?
column3: Yes, proceed to the Baggage Drop counter labeled for online passengers. Keep your digital boarding pass ready.

column2: Where is the Fast-Track service?
column3: Fast-Track counters for premium passengers are beside the main check-in lanes near Row B. Access is through special passes.

column2: What items are restricted in hand luggage?
column3: Sharp objects, liquids over 100 ml, and flammable items are not permitted. Place them in checked baggage to avoid confiscation.

column2: How can I locate my airline counter quickly?
column3: Look for row-wise digital boards showing airline names and counter numbers. Volunteers also assist passengers near entry points.

column2: Can I use one counter for group check-in?
column3: Yes, group passengers may check in together if traveling under the same booking reference. Keep all documents ready.

column2: Where can I change currency before check-in?
column3: Currency-exchange desks are located near the main exit of the check-in hall. They operate 24 hours a day.

column2: How do I know which gate to go to after check-in?
column3: Your boarding pass lists the gate number. Confirm on airport screens as gates may change due to traffic.

column2: Can I carry medicines in hand luggage?
column3: Yes, but liquids must be under 100 ml and prescribed medicines should have a doctor’s note if possible.

column2: What should I do if my name is misspelled on the ticket?
column3: Contact the airline counter immediately. Minor corrections can often be handled before check-in closure.

column2: Is baggage wrapping mandatory?
column3: It’s optional but recommended for fragile or high-value items to prevent tampering.

column2: Where can I charge my phone before check-in?
column3: Charging stations are available beside Row C and near Gate 2. Bring your own cable for convenience.

column2: Can I check in without luggage?
column3: Yes, simply collect your boarding pass and proceed directly to security. Online check-in can save additional time.

column2: Is there assistance for passengers with disabilities?
column3: Yes, wheelchairs and dedicated staff are available on request at Counter 1. Inform your airline in advance if possible.

column2: How can I confirm if my flight is delayed before check-in?
column3: Check the Flight Information Displays or ask the airline counter staff. Updates are announced over the PA system as well.

column2: Can I check in my stroller for my baby?
column3: Yes, you may use it until security check; it will be tagged and returned at the gate after landing.

column2: Where can I store my cabin bag temporarily?
column3: Temporary storage facilities are available beside Gate 3 for short durations, ideal for hand-carry items.

column2: Are there lockers at the departure terminal?
column3: Currently no public lockers; short-term baggage storage is managed through authorized counters only.

column2: How do I reprint a lost boarding pass?
column3: Visit your airline’s counter with CNIC or booking ID; they will reissue it instantly without extra charge.

column2: Can someone accompany me to the check-in area?
column3: Only ticketed passengers are allowed beyond the entrance. Visitors may wait in the public concourse outside.

column2: Is there Wi-Fi at the check-in area?
column3: Yes, free airport Wi-Fi is available. Connect to “IIA-FreeNet” and accept terms on the browser page.

column2: What if my baggage tag tears off?
column3: Immediately report it to the airline agent before check-in closes; they can reissue a new baggage tag.

column2: Can I pay excess baggage by card?
column3: Yes, all major credit and debit cards are accepted at excess-baggage counters. Keep a receipt for airline confirmation.

column2: Where can I find airline help desks?
column3: Airline help desks are placed along each row and at the center of the departure hall. They handle ticket issues and rebookings.

column2: How can I confirm my seat preference?
column3: Seat preferences can be requested during check-in. Window and aisle seats are subject to availability.

column2: How can I check if my baggage is overweight?
column3: Weighing machines are installed beside every airline row and near baggage wrapping stations. If your luggage exceeds the limit, you can adjust items or pay extra at the counter.

column2: What time does the PIA counter open in the morning?
column3: The PIA check-in desk opens three hours before each scheduled flight.

column2: Can I carry liquids in my hand luggage?
column3: You can carry small liquid containers up to 100 ml each, packed inside a transparent plastic bag. Larger bottles should be in checked baggage.

column2: Is there a dedicated counter for business class passengers?
column3: Yes, every major airline offers a separate business-class check-in lane. Staff provide faster processing and lounge access details there.

column2: What if my ticket shows wrong flight time?
column3: Please visit your airline’s check-in desk immediately. They’ll verify it against the latest schedule and issue an updated boarding pass.

column2: Can I rebook my ticket at the check-in desk?
column3: Rebooking is handled at the airline’s main service counter, not at check-in. The desk staff can direct you to the correct window.

column2: Where can I get luggage trolleys?
column3: Luggage trolleys are parked outside the entrance and near every row inside the hall. You can pull one without any fee.

column2: How many bags are allowed per person?
column3: Most airlines allow one checked bag and one hand-carry item per passenger. Policies differ slightly for domestic and international flights.

column2: Can I carry fruits or liquids in my checked bag?
column3: Yes, but pack them securely in leak-proof containers to avoid spoilage or damage during loading.

column2: Is there a counter for unaccompanied minors?
column3: Yes, Counter 2 handles check-in for unaccompanied minors. Staff assist throughout the boarding process until the child is handed over to crew.

column2: Can I pay for extra baggage online?
column3: Most airlines allow pre-purchase of excess baggage through their websites or mobile apps. It’s often cheaper than paying at the counter.

column2: Can I get a duplicate baggage tag?
column3: Yes, you can request a duplicate baggage tag at your airline counter before proceeding to security. Keep both copies safe.

column2: What should I do if I can’t find my airline counter?
column3: Please check the digital screens at the terminal entrance. They list all airlines with current counter locations and flight timings.

column2: Can I check in for connecting flights together?
column3: For most international connections, your luggage can be tagged till the final destination. Confirm at the counter during check-in.

column2: Where do I drop baggage after online check-in?
column3: Go directly to the Baggage Drop counter marked for online passengers. Staff will scan your boarding pass and tag your bags.

column2: How do I check my seat number before boarding?
column3: Your boarding pass clearly mentions the seat number. You can also verify it on your airline’s app before arriving at the airport.

column2: Can I check in 5 hours early?
column3: Usually not. Check-in opens three hours before international and two hours before domestic flights. Arriving too early may not help.

column2: What is the latest time to check in?
column3: Domestic check-in closes 45 minutes before flight time, while international closes one hour prior. Late passengers are not accepted.

column2: Is there any area to sit near the check-in hall?
column3: Yes, public seating areas and cafés are available near the main entrance and beside Row C.

column2: Where can I get flight status updates?
column3: Flight status boards are installed at multiple points, and airline counters display live updates. You may also check the airport’s website.

column2: Can I pay for baggage with cash?
column3: Yes, both cash and digital payments are accepted at all airline desks. Keep your receipt safely for reference.

column2: What if my luggage is damaged at check-in?
column3: Immediately report it to the baggage supervisor at your airline counter. A damage report will be issued before boarding.

column2: Can I carry my drone in luggage?
column3: Drones are usually restricted in hand-carry. Please pack them in checked baggage and inform your airline at check-in.

column2: Are there sanitization measures at counters?
column3: Yes, all counters are regularly sanitized and hand sanitizers are available at every row.

column2: Where can I get flight delay certificates?
column3: Airlines issue official delay letters at their help desks. These can be used for refunds or official claims.

column2: Is there any lost item counter near check-in?
column3: Yes, the Lost Property Desk is beside Gate 2 before security check. Report any misplaced documents there.

column2: Can I request special meals during check-in?
column3: Yes, you can request vegetarian, diabetic, or baby meals if your airline supports it. Do this before check-in closes.

column2: Is there a baby-changing room near check-in?
column3: Yes, baby care rooms are available near Departure Hall B and beside Gate 4.

column2: Can I carry extra handbag with laptop?
column3: Yes, small personal bags like laptop cases are allowed in addition to standard hand-carry, depending on airline rules.

column2: How can I find my luggage belt number?
column3: It’s printed on your baggage tag, and staff at the counter can confirm it before you drop off your luggage.

column2: Can I bring food in hand luggage?
column3: Yes, dry snacks and packed food are fine. Avoid liquids or sauces above 100 ml.

column2: What should I do if I forget my CNIC?
column3: Show your passport or digital CNIC through NADRA app. Airlines accept valid identification for check-in.

column2: Where can I confirm my visa documents?
column3: Airlines verify visas for international flights at the counter before issuing boarding passes.

column2: Can I take my power bank in checked baggage?
column3: Power banks must go in hand-carry bags only. They are not allowed in checked-in luggage.

column2: What are Islamabad Airport’s peak hours?
column3: Peak hours are between 3:00 a.m. – 8:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.. Early check-in is recommended during these slots.

column2: Is there any cloakroom near check-in?
column3: Yes, short-term baggage storage is available for passengers beside Gate 3. Charges apply per hour.

column2: What should I do if my airline counter is closed?
column3: Wait for the counter to open, usually three hours before the flight. Staff may assist if you show your ticket.

column2: Can I check in through a travel agent?
column3: No, check-in must be done at the airport or online by passengers themselves. Agents cannot complete the process.

column2: Can I check in with only soft copy of my ticket?
column3: Yes, digital tickets on mobile devices are accepted at Islamabad Airport counters.

column2: What time should I reach before boarding?
column3: Arrive at least 2 hours early for domestic and 3 hours for international flights. This ensures smooth security clearance.

column2: Is there assistance for elderly passengers?
column3: Yes, wheelchairs and escorts are available free of charge. Contact your airline 24 hours before your flight.

column2: How can I correct my name spelling at check-in?
column3: Name corrections can be done only by airline staff after ID verification. Some airlines charge a small service fee.

column2: Where is the domestic departure zone?
column3: Domestic check-in is handled in Hall C, towards the right wing of the terminal. Signs will guide you.

column2: What happens to oversized baggage?
column3: Oversized or special baggage like strollers and instruments are handled at the Oversize Baggage counter beside Row D.

column2: Can I use check-in kiosks for group booking?
column3: Yes, but you’ll need to check in each passenger individually. Group check-in is faster at the counter.

column2: Is there a currency exchange near check-in area?
column3: Yes, currency exchange desks are available near Gates 2 and 5, open 24/7 for international travelers.

column2: Can I keep my boarding pass on my phone?
column3: Yes, mobile passes are accepted at all scanning points. Ensure the QR code is visible and not damaged.

column2: Are pets allowed at check-in?
column3: Yes, most airlines allow pets if properly caged and with vet certificates. Confirm with your carrier before arrival.

column2: Can I carry gifts in hand luggage?
column3: Yes, but avoid wrapped packages as they may be opened during security scanning.

column2: Is there any assistance for first-time flyers?
column3: Yes, information officers at the entrance guide first-time passengers through check-in and security procedures.

column2: How can I rebook a missed flight at the airport?
column3: If you miss your flight, visit your airline’s ticketing or customer service counter inside the departure area. Depending on seat availability, they may rebook you for the next flight with a nominal fee.

column2: Are there any restaurants before check-in?
column3: Yes, several cafés and food stalls are located in the public concourse area before security. They serve snacks, tea, and coffee around the clock.

column2: Can I check in without printed COVID certificate?
column3: Most airlines now accept digital vaccination proof shown on your phone. Ensure it’s readable and valid for your travel destination.

column2: What should I do if my flight is delayed after check-in?
column3: Stay within the departure lounge area after clearing security. Flight delay announcements are made both over the speakers and on display screens.

column2: Can I check in for connecting flights from different airlines?
column3: If your tickets are on different airlines, you’ll need to check in separately at each airline’s counter. Multi-airline connections are not automatically linked.

column2: What should I do if my baggage is overweight but I can’t remove items?
column3: You may purchase extra baggage allowance directly at the counter. Rates differ per airline and are calculated per kilogram.

column2: Can I check in for a friend or family member?
column3: No, each passenger must be physically present during check-in for ID and baggage verification. However, you can assist them up to the entrance.

column2: How do I know which terminal my flight uses?
column3: Islamabad Airport has a unified terminal, but international and domestic zones are separated. Check your airline confirmation or ask at information desk.

column2: Is there a pharmacy near the check-in area?
column3: Yes, a 24-hour pharmacy is located beside Gate 3 offering basic medicines, baby products, and travel essentials.

column2: Can I check in if my passport is expiring soon?
column3: Airlines typically require at least six months validity for international travel. Please renew before attempting check-in.

column2: Is there a dress code for check-in?
column3: There is no strict dress code, but passengers are advised to dress modestly and avoid clothing with metallic accessories to ease security screening.

column2: Can I carry Zamzam water in my luggage?
column3: Yes, for pilgrims returning from Umrah or Hajj, airlines have dedicated packaging rules for Zamzam water. Ensure it’s sealed and labeled properly.

column2: Can I use Pakistani rupees to pay for extra luggage?
column3: Yes, all airlines operating in Pakistan accept PKR payments. Foreign currency is optional for international travelers.

column2: Is there a customer service counter near check-in?
column3: Yes, the Airport Facilitation Desk is located opposite Row C, assisting passengers with directions, forms, and lost property.

column2: Can I check in with a copy of my passport?
column3: No, original passports are mandatory for international travel. Photocopies are not accepted at check-in counters.

column2: Are there restrooms near the check-in area?
column3: Yes, restrooms are located beside every departure hall gate, kept clean and accessible for all passengers.

column2: Can I get a wheelchair on arrival at check-in?
column3: Yes, request one from your airline staff at the counter or call in advance. Assistance is available from check-in till boarding gate.

column2: Is it allowed to carry perfumes in hand luggage?
column3: Yes, you can carry perfume bottles under 100 ml in your hand luggage. Larger bottles must go in checked bags.

column2: Where can I ask for flight rescheduling?
column3: Rescheduling and cancellations are managed at the ticketing desk of your airline, located beside the main check-in area.

column2: Can I check in with my pet cat?
column3: Yes, cats and small pets can travel if placed in approved carriers and with vaccination records. Inform your airline in advance.

column2: What should I do if my luggage lock is broken?
column3: Inform the counter agent immediately. The damaged lock will be noted on your baggage record to avoid disputes on arrival.

column2: How can I track my luggage after check-in?
column3: Keep your baggage tag receipt. In case of loss, your airline can trace your bag using this number.

column2: Can I check in baby stroller for free?
column3: Yes, strollers are checked in free of charge and returned at the aircraft door upon landing.

column2: What happens if I lose my boarding pass before boarding?
column3: Immediately report it to your airline counter before security. They can reissue it after verifying your ID.

column2: Can I ask for window seat at check-in?
column3: Yes, you may request a window or aisle seat at the counter. Allocation depends on availability.

column2: Is there a prayer room near check-in?
column3: Yes, prayer rooms for men and women are located near Gate 5 inside the departure hall.

column2: Can I carry my camera equipment as hand-carry?
column3: Yes, cameras and lenses can be carried as hand luggage if they meet size and weight limits. Handle carefully during screening.

column2: Is Wi-Fi free during check-in process?
column3: Yes, free Wi-Fi is available throughout the terminal. Connect to IIA-FreeNet and follow on-screen instructions.

column2: How early should I check in for a group flight?
column3: For groups over 5 passengers, it’s best to arrive at least 3.5 hours before departure to ensure everyone is processed together.

column2: Are face masks still required at check-in?
column3: Masks are optional but recommended in crowded areas. Sanitizer dispensers are placed throughout the hall for public use.

column2: Can I check in with damaged luggage?
column3: Yes, but inform the airline staff to mark the condition on your baggage receipt to avoid confusion later.

column2: Can I bring sealed liquids like juice bottles?
column3: Only if they’re under 100 ml in carry-on or sealed properly in checked bags. Otherwise, they may be discarded at security.

column2: Are there ATMs near check-in?
column3: Yes, multiple ATMs are available near the entrance and beside Row B for passenger convenience.

column2: What happens if my printed ticket is blurred?
column3: Staff can verify your booking using the PNR or CNIC number and issue a new boarding pass instantly.

column2: Is there a separate check-in counter for VIPs?
column3: Yes, diplomatic and VIP passengers are assisted at dedicated counters with private waiting areas.

column2: Can I check in power banks in luggage?
column3: No, power banks must be in your hand luggage due to airline safety regulations.

column2: Can I check in sharp items like scissors?
column3: No, sharp items are prohibited in hand luggage. Place them in checked baggage.

column2: Is there an emergency medical service near check-in?
column3: Yes, an airport medical unit operates 24/7 near Gate 3 for emergencies and first aid.

column2: Can I keep extra bags in storage before check-in?
column3: Yes, you can store items temporarily at the baggage service counter beside Row C for a small hourly charge.

column2: Are there smoking areas before check-in?
column3: Smoking zones are available outside the terminal building only. The inside is a smoke-free area.

column2: Can I check in fragile glass items?
column3: Yes, but label them clearly and request a “FRAGILE” tag from the counter staff.

column2: Can I bring electronics like laptops and tablets?
column3: Yes, but remove them from your bags during security screening. Carry them in hand luggage.

column2: Is there any charge for reissuing a lost boarding pass?
column3: Generally no, but some airlines charge a small administrative fee. Confirm with your airline staff.

column2: Can I use digital payment apps to pay baggage fees?
column3: Yes, most airlines accept debit/credit cards and Pakistani digital wallets like Easypaisa or JazzCash for baggage payments.

column2: How do I identify international vs domestic counters?
column3: International counters are marked in blue boards, while domestic are shown in green. Both have visible airline logos overhead.

column2: Is check-in available for transit passengers?
column3: Yes, passengers arriving on connecting flights can recheck baggage at the Transit Help Desk near Gate 6.

column2: Can I carry gifts wrapped in boxes?
column3: Avoid wrapping gifts before check-in. Security might need to inspect inside, so it’s better to wrap them after screening.

column2: Can I check in a bicycle?
column3: Yes, bicycles must be partially dismantled and packed in boxes. Check your airline’s sports equipment policy for charges.

column2: Can I check in without showing my ticket?
column3: No, you must show either a printed or digital ticket along with CNIC or passport at the counter.

column2: What is the procedure for checking in a musical instrument like a guitar?
column3: It can be checked in as fragile, oversized baggage. Some airlines may allow smaller instruments as hand-carry if they fit in the overhead bin.

column2: I am on a standby ticket. Where do I check-in?
column3: Proceed to your airline's ticketing counter. Standby check-in is handled directly by the airline and is subject to seat availability before departure.

column2: Can I check-in if my passport is expiring in less than six months?
column3: Most countries require at least six months of passport validity for entry. Airlines will likely deny boarding. Please check your destination's requirements.

column2: What happens if the airport's check-in system is down?
column3: Airlines will switch to a manual check-in process. Please expect delays and listen for announcements from the staff for guidance.

column2: Is there a student baggage allowance, and how do I claim it?
column3: Many airlines offer extra baggage for students. You must present your valid student ID and mention it at the counter during check-in.

column2: Can I volunteer to give up my seat on an overbooked flight at the check-in desk?
column3: Yes, you can inform the check-in staff. Airlines often provide compensation or benefits to passengers who volunteer on overbooked flights.

column2: What is the process for checking in human ashes (cremated remains)?
column3: You must carry a death certificate and a letter from the crematorium. Inform the airline in advance as rules differ for carrying them in cabin or checked baggage.

column2: I've checked my bag in but realized I left my passport inside it. What can I do?
column3: Immediately inform the airline supervisor at the counter. If the bag has not been loaded, they may be able to retrieve it for you.

column2: Can I get a seat with extra legroom at the check-in counter?
column3: Yes, you can request an extra legroom seat, such as an exit row seat. It is subject to availability and may incur an additional charge.

column2: My flight is a codeshare flight. Which airline counter do I go to?
column3: Go to the check-in counter of the airline operating the flight, not the one you booked with. The operating carrier is mentioned on your ticket.

column2: Are there any porter services available to help with luggage before check-in?
column3: Yes, porter services are available at the entrance of the departure hall for a nominal fee. They can assist you with your luggage up to the check-in counter.

column2: Can I check in a wedding dress? How should I pack it?
column3: Yes. It's best to carry it as hand luggage in a proper garment bag. Inform the check-in staff; they may ask the cabin crew to store it carefully.

column2: Do I need to declare high-value items like jewelry or electronics at check-in?
column3: You don't declare them at check-in, but it's advisable to keep high-value items in your hand luggage. For customs purposes, you may need to declare them upon arrival.

column2: My baggage tag receipt was lost right after check-in. Is that a problem?
column3: Keep your boarding pass safe, as it has your baggage information. You can also request a copy of the baggage receipt from the airline counter before you proceed.

column2: Can I use my airline loyalty points to get an upgrade at the check-in counter?
column3: Yes, this is often possible. Inform the staff of your request; they will check for availability and process the upgrade using your frequent flyer points.

column2: I'm pregnant. Is there any special procedure or priority during check-in?
column3: Yes, please inform the staff. They may guide you to a priority lane. For late-stage pregnancies, you might need a "fit to fly" certificate from your doctor.

column2: Can I check-in and then exit the terminal building to meet someone?
column3: No, once you enter the check-in hall, you are not permitted to exit and re-enter for security reasons.

column2: Are there any post office or mailing services available before security?
column3: Currently, there are no post office facilities available in the departure check-in hall.

column2: Can I check in a child's car seat for free?
column3: Yes, most airlines allow you to check in one car seat or stroller per infant free of charge. Confirm with your airline for their specific policy.

column2: What does the 'SEQ NO' on my boarding pass mean?
column3: It stands for "Sequence Number," which indicates the order in which you checked in for that flight.

column2: If I am denied boarding, where can I get assistance?
column3: The airline check-in supervisor will assist you. They are required to provide you with an explanation and information on compensation or rebooking options.

column2: Can I check in perishable food items like frozen meat?
column3: Yes, but they must be properly packed in a sealed, leak-proof container. The airline is not responsible for spoilage.

column2: My QR code for the mobile boarding pass is not scanning. What should I do?
column3: Don't worry. The airline staff can manually enter your booking reference (PNR) or scan your passport to issue you a printed boarding pass.

column2: Is there a limit to the amount of cash I can carry?
column3: There is no limit to carry cash within the airport, but you must declare amounts over a certain limit to customs before departing on an international flight.

column2: Can I check in with a damaged passport?
column3: If the damage is minor, it might be accepted for domestic flights. For international travel, a damaged passport, especially the photo page, will likely be rejected.

column2: What should I do if a family member and I are seated apart after check-in?
column3: You can request the check-in agent to seat you together. If not possible, you can also ask the gate agent or the cabin crew for assistance.

column2: Is it possible to check in a television or a computer monitor?
column3: Yes, it is checked in as fragile, oversized baggage. It must be in its original sealed box with proper padding. Charges will apply.

column2: How do I know if my checked bag has been screened?
column3: All checked baggage goes through mandatory security screening after you drop it off. You will not be notified unless a physical inspection is required.

column2: Can I check in my baggage and receive my boarding pass a day before my flight?
column3: No, check-in and baggage drop-off are only permitted on the same day as your flight, typically starting 3-4 hours before departure.

column2: What is the 'Final Boarding Call' and what should I do when I hear it?
column3: It is the last announcement for passengers to go to the boarding gate. If you hear your flight announced, you must proceed to the gate immediately.

column2: Can I request a specific meal (e.g., vegan, gluten-free) during check-in?
column3: Meal requests should be made at least 24 hours before the flight through the airline's website or call center. It is not possible to request it at the check-in counter.

column2: Is there a place to get my documents photocopied near the check-in area?
column3: Yes, a photocopying and printing facility is available at the service desk located in the main concourse area for a small fee.

column2: What happens if I have a connecting flight with a very short layover?
column3: Inform the check-in staff. They can add a 'priority' or 'short transit' tag to your luggage to ensure it's transferred quickly to the next flight.

column2: Can I bring my own wheelchair and check it in at the gate?
column3: Yes, you can use your own wheelchair up to the boarding gate. The staff will then check it in for you, and it will be returned to you upon arrival.

column2: My bag is slightly overweight by 1-2 kgs. Will the airline waive the fee?
column3: This is at the discretion of the check-in staff. They may sometimes allow a small margin, but it is not guaranteed. It's best to be within the limit.

column2: What do the different colored tags on checked baggage mean?
column3: The main tag is for routing. Other tags can indicate 'Priority' for premium passengers, 'Heavy' for bags over 15 kg, or 'Fragile' for delicate items.

column2: Can I use a digital copy of my CNIC on my phone for domestic check-in?
column3: No, only the original, physical CNIC card is accepted for identity verification at the check-in counter.

column2: Is there a specific counter for armed forces personnel?
column3: While there isn't always a dedicated counter, airline staff often provide priority assistance to armed forces personnel upon seeing their ID.

column2: Can I check in a box instead of a suitcase?
column3: Yes, you can check in a sturdy, well-sealed cardboard box. Ensure it is properly taped and labeled with your name and contact information.

column2: How do I get my baggage back if I decide to cancel my trip after check-in?
column3: Inform the airline supervisor immediately. The process to offload your baggage can take a significant amount of time.

column2: Is there a dress code for passengers? Can an airline deny check-in based on attire?
column3: There is no official dress code, but airlines reserve the right to deny boarding to passengers wearing offensive or inappropriate clothing.

column2: If I am traveling with a pet, do I need to arrive at the airport earlier than usual?
column3: Yes, it is highly recommended to arrive at least one extra hour early, as checking in with pets involves additional paperwork and verification.

column2: Can I ask the check-in staff to put a 'Fragile' sticker on my bag even if it has clothes?
column3: You can, but it is meant for items that are actually fragile. Overuse can diminish its effectiveness, so only use it when necessary.

column2: Is there a "quiet" or 'silent' area near the check-in hall to wait?
column3: The main check-in hall is generally busy. For a quieter environment, you can use the seating areas away from the main counters or visit a caf茅.

column2: What should I do if the name on my ticket is slightly different from my passport (e.g., missing middle name)?
column3: Minor differences are usually acceptable. Point it out to the check-in agent. For major discrepancies, you would need to contact the airline before your flight.

column2: Can I pay for extra baggage with a foreign credit card?
column3: Yes, major international credit cards like Visa and Mastercard are accepted at the excess-baggage payment counters.

column2: Are all counters for the same airline in one place?
column3: Yes, each airline has its set of counters grouped together in a specific row. Look for the airline's logo on the screens above the counters.

column2: Can I check in if my visa for the destination country is in my old, expired passport?
column3: Yes, provided you are carrying both your old passport (with the valid visa) and your new, valid passport. Present both at the check-in counter.

column2: If I have a medical implant, do I need to declare it at check-in?
column3: You do not need to declare it at check-in, but you should inform the security screening staff before passing through the metal detector.

column2: After checking in my luggage, what is the very next step?
column3: After you receive your boarding pass and baggage receipts, your next step is to proceed towards the immigration and security screening area.
